publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2171# Robin Harper: Sir Patrick Geddes 150th Anniversary Exhibition—That the Parliament congratulates the Ballater Geddes Project on the work it has done over the last year to commemorate the 150th Anniversary of Sir Patrick Geddes; welcomes the project’s exhibition to the Parliament’s garden lobby; notes Sir Patrick Geddes’s extraordinary and profound contribution to the theory and practice of socially and environmentally-sustainable town planning and his historic connections with improving Edinburgh in particular which are being continued by the Geddes Foundation at this present time, and welcomes the exhibition as a timeous reminder of how the thoughts of Sir Patrick Geddes should continue to inspire the planners of today for tomorrow. R
S2M-2171# Sir Patrick Geddes 150th Anniversary Exhibition (lodged on 14 December 2004) Alex Neil*

S2M-2171# Robin Harper: Sir Patrick Geddes 150th Anniversary Exhibition—That the Parliament congratulates the Ballater Geddes Project on the work it has done over the last year to commemorate the 150th Anniversary of Sir Patrick Geddes; welcomes the project’s exhibition to the Parliament’s garden lobby; notes Sir Patrick Geddes’s extraordinary and profound contribution to the theory and practice of socially and environmentally-sustainable town planning and his historic connections with improving Edinburgh in particular which are being continued by the Geddes Foundation at this present time, and welcomes the exhibition as a timeous reminder of how the thoughts of Sir Patrick Geddes should continue to inspire the planners of today for tomorrow. R Supported by: Alex Neil
S2M-2171# Sir Patrick Geddes 150th Anniversary Exhibition (lodged on 14 December 2004) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2171# Sir Patrick Geddes 150th Anniversary Exhibition (lodged on 14 December 2004) Nora Radcliffe*, Sarah Boyack*
S2M-2171# Sir Patrick Geddes 150th Anniversary Exhibition (lodged on 14 December 2004) Linda Fabiani*
